sense.name: take legal action against, as in court
sense.examples: They said that journalists can be prosecuted under current espionage laws. Compton prosecuted him for slander. The representation of a defendant by an attorney who prosecuted him gives rise to a consequential appearance of impropriety. Shoplifters will be prosecuted.

sense.name: carry out or complete an activity
sense.examples: Secure under the protection of France, the king of Spain prosecuted a career of misgovernment. He prosecuted a career which saw him named as the youngest partner in the firm. He afterwards studied law, which study he prosecuted several years in France.
